containerDetails.title: Is Organic Really Better? Healthy Food or Trendy Scam?

keyPoints.title: Less pesticide does not mean none at all. While pesticides are supposed to be a last resort in organic farming, they are not forbidden.

data.title: Human health implications of organic food and organic agriculture: a comprehensive review, 2017

keyPoints.title: Organic pesticides are not necessarily safer than conventional ones.

data.title: Going organic: Are organic pesticides safer than their synthetic counterparts?, 2017

keyPoints.title: Copper sulfate, often used on organic apples, is actually more harmful to humans.

data.title: Organic food: Helping EU consumers make an informed choice, 2015
Human health implications of organic food and organic agriculture: a comprehensive review, 2017

keyPoints.title: A 2018 study from France associated never eating organic food with a higher risk for certain cancers. The study was criticized a lot though: the participants reported their dietary habits themselves, while no actual tests of pesticide in their bodies were done.

content.data: Findings From the NutriNet-Santé Prospective Cohort Study, 2018

In the same issue of JAMA Internal Medicine a critical commentary about the study from Harvard experts was printed that pointed out flaws about the methodology (self-reporting, no empirical measurements proving any connection between higher pesticide residues in the body and cancer incidence.)

data.title: Organic Foods for Cancer Prevention—Worth the Investment?, 2018

keyPoints.title: Danger from pesticides for an adult similar to a glass of wine every three months.

data.title: Corrigendum to “Refined assessment and perspectives on the cumulative risk resulting from the dietary exposure to pesticide residues in the Danish population”[Food and Chemical Toxicology 111 (2018) 207–267], 2018

keyPoints.title: Pesticides are regulated and tested very strictly in the EU and the US.

keyPoints.title: Risk for bacteria and fungi contamination from organic food and non organic food is the same.

content.data: (Less pesticide residues, but danger for environmental contaminants are equally present in foods of both origins)

keyPoints.title: Spain grows tons of regular and organic vegetables in vast green house areas.

content.data: Per capita expenditure in Spain: €36.33 (up 12.58% from 2015)Organic market share: 1.69% of the total food marketOrganic agricultural area: 2.01 million hectares (ranked 1st in terms of size in EU, 5th globally))
